data.title: Marlon Brando Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Marlon Brando with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Mother founded the Omaha Community Playhouse, where she mentored a young Henry Fonda

Expelled from both high school and military academy

Worked as a ditch digger before moving to New York

Made Broadway debut in 1944's I Remember Mama

Voted by critics as Broadway's most promising actor in 1946 after appearing in Truckline Caf√©

Breakthrough role came as Stanley Kowalski in the 1947 Broadway production of A Streetcar Named Desire

Nominated for Oscars for four consecutive years and won on his fourth try for On the Waterfront

Refused to accept his Best Actor Oscar for his role as Don Vito Corleone in 1972's The Godfather because he disapproved of Hollywood's negative depiction of Native Americans

Bought a 12-island Polynesian atoll, Tetiaroa, and occasionally lived there

In 1999, named by Time magazine as one of the 100 Persons of the Century

Best friend and former roommate was actor Wally Cox; he kept Cox's ashes and they were scattered with his own in Death Valley

Awards

1989Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role: nominated

1979Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Special: winner

1974BAFTA Film Awards-Best Actor: nominated

1973BAFTA Film Awards-Best Actor: nominated

1973BAFTA Film Awards-Best Actor: nominated

1973New York Film Critics Circle-Best Actor: winner

1973National Society of Film Critics-Best Actor: winner

1973Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: nominated

1972Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: winner

1972Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: winner

1954BAFTA Film Awards-Best Foreign Actor: winner

1954New York Film Critics Circle-Best Actor: winner

1953BAFTA Film Awards-Best Foreign Actor: winner

1952Cannes Film Festival-Best Actor: winner
